name: CommitOrderLines
description:
This service allows you to manually commit the stock for the given OrderLineIDs.
The response contains whether or not the commitment was successful, per OrderLine.

Commitment can be unsucessful for two reasons:

- No commitment is necessary. This is because it's an OrderLine that can't be committed, for example one without a stock product, or because the order type doesn't allow commitments.
- Insufficient stock. This service only allows creating a commitment when there's sufficient available stock. Use the MoveCommitments or UncommitOrderLines services to create available stock.
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `Commitments:Create`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

C.name: ID
C.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

C.name: QuantityToCommit
C.description:
If specified as non-null and less than the open quantity on the OrderLine this will causse the OrderLine to be split into two.
The ID of the new OrderLine will be returned in the response and the object will have a reference to the OriginalOrderLineID, which is the ID that was specified in the request.

B.name: CommitmentStatus
B.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - Uncommitted
* `1` - SoftCommit
* `2` - HardCommit
* `5` - ManualCommit
* `10` - ForcedCommit

B.name: OrderID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Order`

B.name: OrderLineIDs
B.deprecation_notice:
**Deprecated since 778:** OrderLineIDs is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.786: Use `OrderLines` instead..

**Will be removed in 782**
B.description:
This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

**Deprecated since 778:** OrderLineIDs is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.786: Use `OrderLines` instead..

**Will be removed in 782**

E.name: Code
E.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

E.name: Message
E.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

E.name: RequestID
E.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

E.name: Type
E.description: A short description of the error type.

F.name: ExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

F.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
F.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

F.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
F.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

G.name: OrderLineID
G.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

G.name: OriginalOrderLineID
G.description: This is the ID of a `OrderLine`
